definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to make a lot of excuses

sentences.english: Monosyllabic loanwords constitute only a small proportion of the Chinese loanwords.
sentences.chinese: 汉语借词中，单音节外来词只占一小部分。

sentences.english: Loan word is one way to enrich the vocabulary of a native language.
sentences.chinese: 借词是丰富本民族语言词汇的一种途径。

sentences.english: The appearing of the large number of English loanwords has historic cause and social cause.
sentences.chinese: 这种借词的大量出现有其历史原因和社会原因。

sentences.english: Loanshift: a process in which the meaning is borrowed, but the form is native.
sentences.chinese: 转移借词的意义是借用的，但是形式是来自本国语。

sentences.english: The object of this paper is to study Chinese loanwords in English.
sentences.chinese: 本文所研究的对象是英语中的汉语借词。

sentences.english: Borrowing is a universal linguistic phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 借词是一个普遍的语言现象。

sentences.english: Loan words are products of cultural contacts.
sentences.chinese: 汉语借词是汉语与汉外文化接触的产物。

sentences.english: This article mainly discussed about the impact of Chinese loan words Ordos dialect.
sentences.chinese: 本论文概述了鄂尔多斯土语中的汉语借词情况。

sentences.english: Dong Language in Sanjang is much important data in our study of the Chinese phonological history.
sentences.chinese: 三江侗语汉语借词是汉语语音史研究的重要材料。

definition: translated word (such as company 公司 or bus 巴士 or club 俱樂部|俱乐部)
pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
